name: Eggplant Parmigiana (Parmigiana di Melanzane)
description: Recipe video above. There's a little labour involved in this. But you'll be rewarded with one of the all-time greatest vegetarian comfort foods known to mankind!Assemble ahead, then pop in the oven to bake when you're ready!
recipeIngredient: 1.8kg / 4 lbs  large eggplants (aubergines) - about 5 (, sliced lengthways 8mm (1/3")-thick (skin on, Note 1))
2 cups basil leaves ((loosely packed), stalks reserved)
400g/ 14oz  canned tomatoes (, crushed or finely chopped (Note 4))
1 1/2 tbsp fresh oregano (, finely chopped (or 1/2 tsp dried oregano, or 1 sprig fresh basil))

itemListElement.text: Line three trays: Line three large trays with baking / parchment paper.
itemListElement.name: Line three trays: Line three large trays with baking / parchment paper.

itemListElement.text: Brush eggplant with oil: Brush eggplant slices on each side with oil.
itemListElement.name: Brush eggplant with oil: Brush eggplant slices on each side with oil.

itemListElement.text: Bake 35 minutes: Arrange eggplant in a single layer on the trays and bake for about 35 - 45 mins or until browning and tender, turning the eggplant halfway. I put the trays on the top shelf, in the middle, then I put one tray on the floor of the oven. As each tray finishes, I remove the tray and move the others up.
itemListElement.name: Bake 35 minutes: Arrange eggplant in a single layer on the trays and bake for about 35 - 45 mins or until browning and tender, turning the eggplant halfway. I put the trays on the top shelf, in the middle, then I put one tray on the floor of the oven. As each tray finishes, I remove the tray and move the others up.

itemListElement.text: Cool: Remove from oven, leave on trays to cool.
itemListElement.name: Cool: Remove from oven, leave on trays to cool.

itemListElement.text: Saut√© onions and garlic: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saut√© onions and garlic for 3 minutes until softened and just about to colour on the edges.
itemListElement.name: Saut√© onions and garlic: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saut√© onions and garlic for 3 minutes until softened and just about to colour on the edges.

itemListElement.text: Add remaining ingredients: Pour in the passata , canned tomatoes, water, oregano and sugar. Stir and bring to a simmer.
itemListElement.name: Add remaining ingredients: Pour in the passata , canned tomatoes, water, oregano and sugar. Stir and bring to a simmer.

itemListElement.text: Simmer 30 minutes: Simmer uncovered for about 30 - 40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened, adding the basil stalks halfway through cooking (so they don‚Äôt lose their flavour).
itemListElement.name: Simmer 30 minutes: Simmer uncovered for about 30 - 40 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened, adding the basil stalks halfway through cooking (so they don‚Äôt lose their flavour).

itemListElement.text: The final consistency should be slightly thicker than a pasta sauce so it‚Äôs spreadable and not leaching liquid, but not too pasty either. Add extra water a little at a time if required during cooking if it gets too thick. Remove the basil stalks and discard.
itemListElement.name: The final consistency should be slightly thicker than a pasta sauce so it‚Äôs spreadable and not leaching liquid, but not too pasty either. Add extra water a little at a time if required during cooking if it gets too thick. Remove the basil stalks and discard.

itemListElement.text: Season: Stir in salt and pepper. (Remember, we get salt from the parmesan too, so no need to go overboard here)
itemListElement.name: Season: Stir in salt and pepper. (Remember, we get salt from the parmesan too, so no need to go overboard here)

itemListElement.text: Smear a little tomato sauce in the bottom of baking dish, 23 x 33cm / 9 x 13" (or thereabouts).
itemListElement.name: Smear a little tomato sauce in the bottom of baking dish, 23 x 33cm / 9 x 13" (or thereabouts).

itemListElement.text: Layer 1: Lay one third of the eggplant so it covers the base (some overlap is OK when layering eggplant). Spread 1/3 of the remaining sugo over eggplant. Drizzle with a little olive oil. Sprinkle with 1/3 of the parmesan, and 1/3 of basil leaves.
itemListElement.name: Layer 1: Lay one third of the eggplant so it covers the base (some overlap is OK when layering eggplant). Spread 1/3 of the remaining sugo over eggplant. Drizzle with a little olive oil. Sprinkle with 1/3 of the parmesan, and 1/3 of basil leaves.

itemListElement.text: Layer 2: Repeat another 1/3 each of eggplant, tomato sauce, olive oil, basil and parmesan.
itemListElement.name: Layer 2: Repeat another 1/3 each of eggplant, tomato sauce, olive oil, basil and parmesan.

itemListElement.text: Layer 3 (top layer): Repeat again with remaining eggplant, tomato sauce and some olive oil. Do not put basil on top layer (we will garnish after baking). Scatter with remaining parmesan, then all the mozzarella.
itemListElement.name: Layer 3 (top layer): Repeat again with remaining eggplant, tomato sauce and some olive oil. Do not put basil on top layer (we will garnish after baking). Scatter with remaining parmesan, then all the mozzarella.

itemListElement.text: Bake for 25 mins until bubbling and golden.
itemListElement.name: Bake for 25 mins until bubbling and golden.

itemListElement.text: Rest: Let it rest for 5 to 10 minutes (easier to slice neatly). Scatter over remaining fresh basil leaves. Cut like lasagna and serve! (Optional: sprinkle with extra parmesan).
itemListElement.name: Rest: Let it rest for 5 to 10 minutes (easier to slice neatly). Scatter over remaining fresh basil leaves. Cut like lasagna and serve! (Optional: sprinkle with extra parmesan).

review.reviewBody: Absolutely delicious, can‚Äôt believe it was sooo good. Another winner Nagi üòãüëç
So good. I don't even make normal lasagna anymore. A batch of this, and the leftovers we freeze in portions for when cooking is just too hard. Yumm!!

I made this last week. OMG it is delicious!  I usually bread and fry individual slices the top with tomato sauce and cheeses, not anymore!  This is now my go to eggplant parmigiana recipe.  I can‚Äôt wait to make it again.
Hi Jill! I used both the crushed tomatoes and passata - sauce came out perfect! So excited to make this again as a regular weekly meal prep staple. Thank you Nagi + Dozer!
This was delicious and so easy - baking the eggplant is the way to go!

This was so good and so easy - thank you! 
We had a surplus of zucchinis so I did a layer of zucchini as well as the eggplant - I didn't precook the zucchini, but sliced them very thinly, and it turned out great.

I made this via your cook book. ü§©
You have yet to fail me on any recipe and this was no different! 

This dish was so scrumptious and delicious! I'm looking forward to another serving for dinner tonight. 
(This is the dish I'll cook for a man I like... ü§£).

I used mostly organic ingredients; 
5 eggplants, canned cherry and whole tomatoes. I only added a little more salt to the sauce when it was finished. 
Avocado oil for baking the eggplant and the sauce (remains healthy at higher smoke points). Olive oil for the layering. 

In the book, it says it isn't suitable to freeze but on the website, it does. 
I'm going to freeze it! It's only me and I can't finish the beautiful dish in time. 

Thanks Nagi, you're the absolute best!

This was the best Eggplant Parmesan I have ever had!  Light and delish. I tasted the sauce partway through and thought about tweaking it a bit but decided to ‚Äújust trust Nagi‚Äù because I‚Äôve not tried a recipe that has disappointed. It was perfect and is now my go to recipe for eggplant. Yum!

Such an amazingly tasty and easy recipe. I have lots of eggplant in my garden at the moment and am cooking this for dinner tonight‚Ä¶again. We love it

Definitely Five stars from me even though I can‚Äôt get the rating system work.
Another fantastic vegetarian recipe - I now have an eggplant addiction after this and your eggplant curry recipe. I didn‚Äôt know it could be so delicious.
I really enjoyed this recipe. I slightly burnt the eggplant, but what I salvaged was delicious. Easy to throw together with some leftover vegetables from the crisper; zucchini, carrot etc.
This eggplant recipe was delicious. It‚Äôs definitely a keeper. Looking forward to making it for friends & family to try. Thank you Nagi x

Such an amazingly tasty and easy recipe. I have lots of eggplant in my garden at the moment and am cooking this for dinner tonight‚Ä¶again. We love it
Definitely Five stars from me even though I can‚Äôt get the rating system work.
